article.title: Descriptions of new Tortricidae (Lepidoptera) reared from native fruit in Kenya
article.abstract: One new genus, Concinocordis (Enarmoniini), and 13 new species, Phtheochroa aarviki (Cochylini), Endothenia ator(Bactrini), Concinocordis wilsonarum, Anthozela psychotriae (both Enarmoniini), Cosmetra podocarpivora, Cosmetrataitana, Gypsonoma scolopiae (all Eucosmini), Thaumatotibia salaciae, Cydia connara, Cydia sennae, Fulcrifera crota-lariae, Stenentoma sorindeiae, and Thylacogaster garcinivora (all Grapholitini), are described and illustrated. All speci-mens of these new species were reared from native fruit in Kenya. Two new combinations are proposed, Cydia anthracotis(Meyrick) (transferred from “Laspeyresia”) and Cosmetra nereidopa (Meyrick) (transferred from Sycacantha), and the female genitalia of Anthozela chrysoxantha Meyrick are illustrated for the first time.

indexing.subject: Afrotropical Region; genitalia; host plants; moths; new genus; new species; systematics; USAID

article.title: Mayflies of the Caucasus Mountains. I. A new species of the genus Electrogena Zurwerra & Tomka, 1985
article.abstract: Based on the material recently collected in the Western Caucasus Mts., Russian Federation, Electrogena gibedede sp. nov.,new species from the genus Electrogena Zurwerra & Tomka, 1985 is described in detail. The morphological characteris-tics of the adults and larvae of the species are presented (adults of both sexes were reared from the larvae in the field). Thevariability of the species and critical characteristics distinguishing Electrogena gibedede sp. nov. from the remaining rep-resentatives of the genus (focusing mainly on Caucasian species) are described and discussed. In the description of thelarval morphology the standard set of diagnostic characteristics is used. Larval biology and habitat preferences are mentioned. An overview of the present state of knowledge of Electrogena species known from the Caucasus Mts. is provided.

indexing.subject: Ephemeroptera; Heptageniidae; differential diagnosis; taxonomy; biology; distribution

article.title: The species of Priopoda Holmgren (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) from China with a key to species known in Oriental and Eastern Palaearctic Regions
article.abstract: Nine species of Priopoda Holmgren, 1856, are reported from China. Five, Priopoda biconcava Sheng & Sun, sp.n., P.dentata Sheng & Sun, sp.n., P. dorsopuncta Sheng & Sun, sp.n., P. nigrifacialis Sheng & Sun, sp.n. and P. uniconcavaSheng & Sun, sp.n. collected from Jiangxi Province, situated in the northern border of the Oriental part of China, are newto science. Two, Priopoda owaniensis (Uchida, 1930) and P. sachalinensis (Uchida, 1930), are new records for China. A key to species of Priopoda Holmgren known in Oriental and Eastern Palaearctic Region is provided.

indexing.subject: Ctenopelmatinae; taxonomy; Priopoda; new species; China; Oriental Region; Eastern Palaearctic Region

article.title: Batrisoplisus Raffray, 1908, a new synonymy of Trisinus Raffray, 1894 (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae), with description of three new Chinese species
article.abstract: The genus Batrisoplisus Raffray, 1908 is synonymized with Trisinus Raffray, 1894, with twenty-two new combinations:T. amamianus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. constrictus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. esakii (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T.galloisi (Jeannel, 1958) comb. n., T. inermis (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. monostatos (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. oka-motoi (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. parallelus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. raffrayi (Jeannel, 1958) comb. n., T.sagamianus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. satsumanus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. sawadai (Nomura, 1991) comb. n.,T. subtilis (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. tamino (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. tanabei (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. tenui-formis (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. torticornis (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. tosanus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. uroce-ratus brevispinis (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. uroceratus uroceratus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n., T. venustus (Jeannel,1958) comb. n. and T. volcaninsulanus (Nomura, 1991) comb. n. Trisinus is recorded for the first time from China. Threenew species from Yunnan Province are described, illustrated and keyed: T. pharelatus Yin & Nomura sp. n., T.shaolingiger Yin & Nomura sp. n. and T. shuixiuifer Yin & Nomura sp. n. A checklist of the world species of Trisinus is provided.

indexing.subject: Staphylinidae; Pselaphinae; Batrisoplisus; Trisinus; taxonomy; new synonym; new species; identification key; checklist; China
